conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, we need to find the time t when their positions are equal. This can be done by comparing the areas under the velocity-time graphs for both particles up to that time.
Identify the equations for the velocities of A and B.
For particle A: From 0 to t_0: v_A = (2v_0/t_0) t. From t_0 to 3t_0: v_A = 2v_0 - (v_0/t_0) (t - t_0).
For particle B: From 0 to 5t_0: v_B = (v_0/5t_0) t. From 5t_0 to 6t_0: v_B = v_0 - (v_0/t_0) (t - 5t_0).
Calculate the position of A as a function of time.

premise: For particle A: From 0 to t_0: v_A = (2v_0/t_0) t.
For particle A: From t_0 to 3t_0: v_A = 2v_0 - (v_0/t_0) (t - t_0).

conclusion: Calculate the position of B as a function of time.

premise: For particle B: From 0 to 5t_0: v_B = (v_0/5t_0) t.
For particle B: From 5t_0 to 6t_0: v_B = v_0 - (v_0/t_0) (t - 5t_0).

conclusion: After solving these equations, we find that the particles meet at t = 4t_0.
